verses.verse: Now you Philippians know also that in the beginning of the gospel, when I departed from Macedonia, (2 Cor. 11:8, 9) no church shared with me concerning giving and receiving but you only.
For even in Thessalonica you sent aid once and again for my necessities.
Not that I seek the gift, but I seek (Titus 3:14) the fruit that abounds to your account.

Indeed I have all and abound. I am full, having received from (Phil. 2:25) Epaphroditus the things sent from you, (Heb. 13:16) a sweet-smelling aroma, (Rom. 12:1; 2 Cor. 9:12) an acceptable sacrifice, well pleasing to God.
And my God (Ps. 23:1; 2 Cor. 9:8) shall supply all your need according to His riches in glory by Christ Jesus.
(Rom. 16:27) Now to our God and Father be glory forever and ever. Amen.
Greeting and Blessing Greet every saint in Christ Jesus. The brethren (Gal. 1:2) who are with me greet you.
All the saints greet you, but especially those who are of Caesarâ€™s household.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
Greeting Paul, (Eph. 1:1) an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother,
To the saints (1 Cor. 4:17) and faithful brethren in Christ who are in Colosse: (Gal. 1:3) Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Their Faith in Christ (1 Cor. 1:4; Eph. 1:16; Phil. 1:3) We give thanks to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,
(Eph. 1:15) since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus and of ((Heb. 6:10)) your love for all the saints;
because of the hope ((1 Pet. 1:4)) which is laid up for you in heaven, of which you heard before in the word of the truth of the gospel,

which has come to you, (Matt. 24:14) as it has also in all the world, and (John 15:16) is bringing forth fruit, as it is also among you since the day you heard and knew (Eph. 3:2) the grace of God in truth;
as you also learned from (Col. 4:12; Philem. 23) Epaphras, our dear fellow servant, who is (1 Cor. 4:1, 2; 2 Cor. 11:23) a faithful minister of Christ on your behalf,
who also declared to us your (Rom. 15:30) love in the Spirit.

Preeminence of Christ (Eph. 1:15-17) For this reason we also, since the day we heard it, do not cease to pray for you, and to ask (1 Cor. 1:5) that you may be filled with ((Rom. 12:2); Eph. 5:17) the knowledge of His will (Eph. 1:8) in all wisdom and spiritual understanding;

(Eph. 4:1; Phil. 1:27; 1 Thess. 2:12) that you may walk worthy of the Lord, (1 Thess. 4:1) fully pleasing Him, (Heb. 13:21) being fruitful in every good work and increasing in the (2 Pet. 3:18) knowledge of God;
((Eph. 3:16; 6:10)) strengthened with all might, according to His glorious power, (Eph. 4:2) for all patience and longsuffering ((Acts 5:41); 2 Cor. 8:2; (Heb. 10:34)) with joy;
((Eph. 5:20)) giving thanks to the Father who has qualified us to be partakers of (Eph. 1:11) the inheritance of the saints in the light.
He has delivered us from (Eph. 6:12) the power of darkness (2 Pet. 1:11) and conveyed us into the kingdom of the Son of His love,
(Eph. 1:7) in whom we have redemption through His blood, the forgiveness of sins.
He is (2 Cor. 4:4; Heb. 1:3) the image of the invisible God, (Ps. 89:27; Rev. 3:14) the firstborn over all creation.

For (John 1:3; Heb. 1:2, 3) by Him all things were created that are in heaven and that are on earth, visible and invisible, whether thrones or ((Eph. 1:20, 21; Col. 2:15)) dominions or principalities or powers. All things were created (John 1:3; Rom. 11:36; 1 Cor. 8:6; Heb. 2:10) through Him and for Him.
((John 17:5)) And He is before all things, and in Him (Heb. 1:3) all things consist.
And (1 Cor. 11:3; Eph. 1:22) He is the head of the body, the church, who is the beginning, (Rev. 1:5) the firstborn from the dead, that in all things He may have the preeminence.
Reconciled in Christ For it pleased the Father that (John 1:16) in Him all the fullness should dwell,
and (Rom. 5:1; Eph. 2:14) by Him to reconcile (2 Cor. 5:18) all things to Himself, by Him, whether things on earth or things in heaven, (Eph. 1:10) having made peace through the blood of His cross.
